That may have been true, but the bed was a little soft for me. Regardless, it was easy to get in and out and was close to many restaurants as well as the beach. We would stay here again. Summary: My son and three friends were robbed while they slept in their room on May 8 at the Clarion.  My son woke up at 3 am to someone at the bedside table stealing his phone and watch.  His friend's wallet was also stolen.  The hotel management was evasive in acknowledging the incident, even though the police responded. The hotel management has taken no action or accepted responsibility for the security breach.  My family will never stay in a Clarion or Choice Hotel property again.
Manager Response: Dear valued guest: As you, we were disappointed and shocked by the events of the evening.  This has never occurred at this location even though any hotel can be targeted, whether it‚Äôs a 3 star or 5 star property.  As with all safety or security incident, we look to first thoroughly investigate the events by having a direct conversation with the people involved, checking the readings from the lock and ensuring that a police report is filed.  In this specific situation, when the hotel team was informed of the incident, the managers started the investigation process immediately gathering more information, contacted the local police department asking for more presence in the area, informed the corporate office of the incident with a corporate team member being dispatched to the property to assist in the investigation and following up with the guests onsite.  Additionally, at our urging, we had one of the occupants file a report with the police department a couple of days after the event in question to ensure all proper steps were taken; until that time, no one from the room had filed a report.  We did not attempt to comment on the situation until we had all the facts.  But after hearing the story from 1 of the occupants, inspecting our lock system and reading the lock logs, it was evident that the room was not accessed using any type of room key.  We could only assume at this point that the room door was left ajar allowing access.  For this reason and overall safety of our guests, we highly suggest that they use the latch lock and the deadbolt which are provided in all the rooms as a necessary precaution.  We, as a hotel team and company, will continue to make safety a priority and look for opportunities to improve our operation and to educate our team and guests on hotel safety and security.  General Manager

We appreciate the opportunity to serve you during your time here, and we hope to see you again in the future.  Sincerely, Andre Neuman Assistant General Manager

This hotel was close to restaurants and the staff was very helpful in giving us directions to the restaurants. The room was excellent. I sat out on the balcony and read a book and it was very peaceful. I highly recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review your stay at our hotel. I'm absolutely thrilled to hear your stay was such a wonderful experience! I'm happy to say our breakfast area remodel is complete, and the new bistro is being officially opened this coming Monday. Thank you so much for allowing us to be a part of your visit to the area, and we hope to see you again soon!  Sincerely, Andre Neuman Assistant General Manager

Summary: Only 8-10 rooms left to upgrade, then the outside. We were a bit concerned until we got to our room. It was like new. Includes a microwave, fridge and coffee pot. Also, free shuttle from airport, but you need to pre-schedule. We got in near midnight and the shuttle was waiting for us.  Very friendly front desk staff on late and morning shifts. The Continental breakfast is one of the victims of the remodeling. None of the ubiquitous waffles found everywhere, but the Jimmy Dean  sausage breakfast sandwich plus fruit, yogurt, etc., did the job.I don't recall the completion date but I believe they are also adding a restaurant, which will be nice.   When the shuttle driver called in sick we driven my the General Manager, a very nice guy, whose name I do not recall.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review your stay at out hotel. I'm delighted to hear that overall your stay was a very pleasant experience! Since your stay we have completed most of the work, and at this point are well underway to finishing the repainting of the exterior as well. Our new bistro is opening on a limited scale this weekend and will hit full swing this coming Monday. Our GM, Doug Mills, is a wonderful manager and is always happy to help out our guests. Thank you for allowing us to be a part of your visit to the area, and we hope to see you again soon!  Sincerely, Andre Neuman Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Not What I was Expecting from Clarion
Summary: It is hard to accurately rate this hotel, as they are apparently undergoing a remodel of sorts.  It looks like they are trying out paint schemes in the courtyard area; the place otherwise looks like it already has 20 coats of paint. The lobby looks like it recently had been updated, check in was fast and friendly.  The room we were in had also been updated - and perhaps upgraded, with new bathroom flooring and fixtures, and a pleasant feel throughout the room.  Just not a lot of places to sit. The pool area is pleasant, surrounded by tall palms.  The water was nice and clear, but a lot of sand & debris at the bottom of the pool and hot tub.  Not very inviting...it Is February, but it is 80 degrees out today.  The concrete deck surface is worn to the point of being uncomfortable
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review your stay at our hotel. Since your stay we have very nearly completed the renovations, and will be finishing the work in the very near future. Our breakfast has been moved back into the lobby, and as of this coming Monday will be being served out of our new bistro. A great deal has changed in the last couple months, and I truly hope we'll see you again in the near future!  Sincerely, Andre Neuman Assistant General Manager

Summary: Nothing in advertisement prepared us for the shape this Clarion was in. Couldn't use the heated pool or hot tub due to debris from roof construction. The "breakfast" which was set up in a stripped hotel room had no seating. The food was flavourless, kind of like food tastes when you have a bad cold. This place needs help, until then avoid it. The drone of construction equipment during the whole day was annoying & despite complaining about the drunks yelling, arguing & slamming doors until after 1:30am no help from staff. We won't return.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review your stay at our hotel. I truly apologize for your stay being anything less than excellent. Since the time of your stay we have completed 99% of all the work and we will have it all finished in the very near future. Our breakfast has since been relocated back into the lobby, and our new bistro is open and ready to serve our guests. I'm very sorry for your previous stay, and I wholeheartedly invite you to return to experience the difference all of our hard work has made since then.  Sincerely, Andre Neuman Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Don't always believe all the reviews
Summary: After reading some reviews i was very leery about my stay. Upon arrival i was promptly greeted by the desk clerk and she checked me in. We went to out room on the 3rd floor at the rear of the building upon unloading as i knew already about the renovations being done. The workers were there working wasn't to noisy but a little messy as to be expected when you are renovating. As the day/night progressed noted that the Construction workers checked out early and left for the weekend so no weekend noise.Pool/Spa area was clean and spacious. We were here for a Disneyland trip and was pleasantly surprised as the drive is not to far and you are between John Wayne Airport and Disneyland and hotel is very easy to gain freeway access so commute was minimal.So a definite recommend if going
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review your stay at our hotel. I'm delighted to hear that even with the renovations going at that time your stay was a great experience! We are now in the final phase of the renovations and will have them completed in the very near future. Thank you for making us a part of your visit to the area, and we hope to see you again soon!  Sincerely, Andre Neuman Assistant General Manager

Summary: When done with construction will earn four stars. People here are real nice. Breakfast is in a room for now but they are trying hard. Beds and pillows are great.  Pool and got tub look good. Wish it was warmer.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay at out hotel. I'm delighted to hear you enjoyed your stay! The renovations should be complete within the next month or so, and we're looking forward to having our new bistro up and running. Thank you for allowing us to be a part of your visit to the area, and we hope to see you again soon!  Sincerely, Andre Neuman Assistant General Manager

Summary: Hotel is in need of upgrade and improvement. The room I had on the east side of the property is apparently for long term residents. Not very pleasant. Hotel grounds in need of improvements. Hotel staff very friendly and professional. Room clean and nicely sized. King bed comfortable with plenty of pillows. Linens and bathroom clean. Small refrigerator and microwave in room. Shower has plenty of hot water, but shower head somewhat wimpy. Bath towels nice and absorbent. HDTV has all the channels. Room nicely sized with sofa-bed and desk. Parking so-so. Area is a bit weird walking around. I didn't feel 100% comfortable. Overall, the hotel is ok.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay at our hotel. I apologize that your stay was anything less than excellent. We actually do not offer a long term stay at our hotel, and there is a 28 day limit on any stay. We have been renovating the hotel for just shy of a year now, and will be completing the renovations within the next month or so. I'm glad to hear that overall your stay was at least pleasant. Thank you for making us a part of your visit to the area, and I hope you'll consider returning to us in the future to experience the difference the completed renovations make.  Thank you, Andre Neuman Assistant General Manager

Summary: Under renovation and was unaware until arrival. The room we stayed in was dated. Sliding bathroom door was hard to operate. Breakfast was poor. Walls don't offer much of a barrier from outside or nearby room noises. In room coffee was decaf only. Thought maybe they made a mistake but second day had the same thing.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Apparently there are rooms that have already been rennovated and yet I was given the oldest room I have ever been in, tucked in the back end of the hotel near the laundry room.  The breakfast was WITHOUT ANY EXAGGERATION, DISSSSGUSTING.  Pre packaged breakfast sandwhiches.  I took on bite and I could not even fake it,, I had to spit it out.  Only cereal available was sugar coated crap.  So, the point is, ask for a NEW ROOM and if the free breakfast is leading you here,,, TRUST me , it is in NO WAY an added value and you will need to go out to eat any way. NOT every web site advertises that this location is "under rennovation".  At least I should have been given a newly rennovated room. The pool was fine and the hot tub was definitely a huge PLUS!  Bed was outdated.  Not a

Since your stay the room you were in has been placed out of order and the remodeling of it has begun. By the end of January we will have the remodeling completed on the last few rooms as well as the majority of the rest of the renovations. Our new bistro is scheduled to be complete by the first of the year, and we look forward to once again offering our guests a wonderful selection for breakfast. We hope you'll return to us again in the future and experience the difference.  Sincerely, Andre Neuman  Assistant General Manager

Summary: The Clarion, a handsome Spanish style facility, is being extensively renovated (formerly a Comfort Inn). My king room was refurbished, updated, and upgraded. The Lobby,  breakfast area and other public areas are still under renovation but this did not affect my stay. The room was good-sized, clean and comfortable with a nice large bath and good shower, desk, comfortable side chair and basic amenities including a microwave, refrigerator and coffee maker. Good flat screen TV, Wi-Fi and lots of plug-ins. An elevator is available for rooms on upper floors . My room had a nice view of the attractive courtyard and pool area. Breakfast was set-up in a temporary room and was a bit limited. A shuttle was available to John Wayne airport.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Wonderful hotel, beautifully remodeled rooms, friendly staff!
Summary: Absolutely great stay at this hotel! The staff is wonderful! They're currently undergoing some renovations, but are very accommodating. Work was not loud or disturbing. Remodeled rooms are simply beautiful!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking he time to review your recent stay at our hotel. I'm absolutely thrilled to hear your stay was such an excellent experience! The hotel is going through a remodel and construction work starts at 7:00AM. So much for sleeping in and relaxing! When I complained to the morning shift, I was told that I would "just have to deal with it!" I feel the Management should have posted a note to indicate the property would be very noisy after 7:00AM.

Summary Heading: Ok place, terrible stay because of ongoing renovation
Summary: Let me start with the positives..  We had a pretty good stay. We loved the proximity of the hotel to the freeways and the university.  A few decent places to eat nearby. Rooms are spacious with good facilities. Restrooms are big and one does not feel cramped. The staff were pretty good and helped us resolve a few issues.  On to the negatives.  The hotel is undergoing remodeling. This was mentioned in fine print and hence many people were not aware of it.  * We had booked a room with a king bed and sofabed and had requested for a few extra sheets and the sofabed to be cleaned as we might have an additional guest for a night. But that was not done * The room that was allocated to us was right next to where construction was happening and we were woken up not by our alarm, but by

Once the renovation is complete, this will be a desirable location.

Summary: This older hotel is getting a complete overhaul. The room I stayed in was clean, comfortable and had been recently renovated. As I walked around the property, there was a great deal of renovation going on. The outside was being painted and it will soon be finished. The towels and bathroom supplies were quality.The staff was efficient and the breakfast was great. I highly recommend this property.

The exterior lights were burned out by our room (safety issue at night) Construction materials and ladders were left out in the parking lot on the property unsecured (danger for young children). It was a standard room with one bed and couch separated by a 3 foot wall. Sorry this is not a suite. It was a old and tired room. The sheets had stains on them. The pull out bed had a old dirty matress with a bodily fluid stain. Having no Choice, we slept on it so our kids did not have to. Every turn at night, we were poked by the bed frame and endured a faint smell of urine. The bathroom door did not work and the ceiling had water

Summary Heading: Dont let the picture fool you.

Summary: Love this place. We stayed here 4 times in 4 months while relocating to Orange County 3 years ago, and when we had a household emergency last week it was this hotel we chose. The common area included tables and chairs, as well as seating around the pool. The building also had ample parking.    The breakfast was fairly good, including hot sausage, egg, and waffles.  Nothing fancy, but certainly more than I had expected.  There can be a rush for the hot food, though, so I recommend going earlier in the breakfast time period.    The room was pretty good, nice and spacious, including a couch.  I didn't spend much time there, so I can't comment extensively, but there was nothing to complain about.  There were many pillows already on the bed, and the shower was good quality.  The only comment I would

Summary Heading: Our MEMORIAL TO 84 VICTIMS OF PLANE CRASH 50 YEARS AGO....JUNE 25, 1965
Summary: Coming to Orange Co, for this memorial for the victims of a plane crash in 1965, I was representing the Marine Body Recovery Team......that day changed my life and I often think about that day, the men and what we had to go thru to bring them back to their families............Comfort Inn was a nice get away from the activities.

Only issue we encountered was lack of parking due to painting and the workers removed the tape to get us some parking. The hotel was quiet and rooms were clean.
